actions.text: Reported to House from the Committee on Rules, H. Rept. 94-417.
Measure called up by unanimous consent in House.

official_title: Resolution providing certain procedures during the further consideration of H.R. 7014.  A bill to increase domestic energy supplies and availability; to restrain energy demand; and to prepare for energy emergencies.

summary.text: Provides that when the House proceeds in the Committee of the Whole House on the State of the Union to the further consideration of the bill (H.R. 7014) to increase domestic energy supplies and availability; to restrain energy demand; to prepare for energy emergencies; and for other purposes, it shall be in order to consider, without the intervention of any point of order, the text of an amendment which was placed in the Congressional Record of Monday, July 28, 1975, on pages H7721-7722 by Representative Robert Krueger. Directs that after the passage of H.R. 7014, the Committee on Interstate and Foreign Commerce shall be discharged from the further consideration of the bill S. 622, and it shall then be in order in the House to move to strike out all after the enacting clause of the said Senate bill and insert in lieu thereof the provisions contained in H.R. 7014 as passed by the House.

titles.title: Resolution providing certain procedures during the further consideration of H.R. 7014.  A bill to increase domestic energy supplies and availability; to restrain energy demand; and to prepare for energy emergencies.
